intro: Draba saffordii, commonly known as Safford's whitlow grass, is a small, flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers in early spring, followed by small, rounded seeds. Draba saffordii is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
